paper_title: A distinctive red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst with efficient photocatalytic oxidative and reductive activities

result.query: What is the chemical name of the catalyst used in the experiment?

evidences.pdf_reference: Optical absorption, as the fundamental requirement of photocatalysts, still has immense space for development.Herein, we design a novel kind of red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst, by which a large improvement of visible-light harvesting was obtained.These strongly coloured semiconductor materials can be facilely prepared using a versatile glycerol-mediated method and exhibit a uniform coaxial tricubic morphology.The enhancement of optical absorption is not only ascribed to the synergy of Ag and AgCl but also attributed to the Mie scattering effect due to the distinct morphology.As expected, the
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. Photocatalysts require Optical absorption.
2. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalist is a type of Photocatalysts.
3. Visible light can be harvested by Red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst.
4. Semiconductor materials are composed of Red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst.
5. Glycerol is used in the preparation of Semiconductor materials.
6. Method is used to prepare Semiconductor materials.
7. Mie scattering effect occurs due to the morphology of Semiconductor materials.
8. Space for development has immense space for Optical absorption.
9. Synergy of Ag and AgCl contributes to Enhancement of optical absorption.
10. Morphology affects Mie scattering effect.
11. Enhancement of optical absorption is attributed to Synergy of Ag and AgCl.
12. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst exhibits Uniform coaxial tricubic morphology.

5. Concentration of MO at real-time time refers to C.
6. Concentration of MO at 10 mg L-1 refers to C0.
7. Ag/AgCl photocatalysts are used in photoreduction reactions.
8. K2CrO4 solution at 15 mg L-1 contains Cr(VI).
9. A light source is used by a UV cutter of wavelength 420 nm.
10. Specied dispersion at 600 mL is part of the reaction system.
11. The photoreduction reaction involves Ag/AgCl photocatalysts and K2CrO4 solution at 15 mg L-1.

Abstract

evidences.pdf_reference: but also attributed to the Mie scattering effect due to the distinct morphology.As expected, the asprepared red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts exhibit highly enhanced photocatalytic activities in the degradation of organic dyes, reduction of hexavalent chromium and conversion of CO 2 into liquid hydrocarbon fuels.By means of theoretical calculations, furthermore, this work provides an in-depth perspective for understanding the physical photocatalytic mechanism of the red Ag/AgCl system and should stimulate the development of silver halide-based photocatalysts for the exploitation and utilization of
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts exhibit highly enhanced photocatalytic activities.
2. Theoretical calculations provide in-depth perspective for understanding physical photocatalytic mechanism of red Ag/AgCl system.
3. Silver halide-based photocatalysts develop from red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.
4. Photocatalysts include red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.
5. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts degrade organic dyes.
6. Theoretical calculations be understood through physical photocatalytic mechanism of red Ag/AgCl system.
7. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts reduce hexavalent chromium.
8. Photocatalysts include red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.
9. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts convert CO 2 into liquid hydrocarbon fuels.
10. Silver halide-based photocatalysts be exploited and utilized for red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.
11. Red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts form part of silver halide-based photocatalysts.
12. Cl (chlorine) form part of red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.
13. Ag (silver) form part of red Ag/AgCl photocatalysts.

evidences.pdf_reference: was then maintained at 60 C for 1 h, and nally a milky dispersion was obtained.Aerwards, the reaction system was warmed up to 140 C at a heating rate of 2 C min A1 (within 40 min) and maintained at this temperature for another 20 min before it was cooled down to room temperature naturally.Finally, the reddish-brown suspension was treated by centrifugation (10 000 rpm, 5 min) to collect the resulted red NPs and rinsed thoroughly rst with acetone and then with water several times (at least 3 times).For comparison, normal Ag/AgCl materials are prepared by mixing aqueous AgNO 3 (0.01 mol L A1 )
evidences.generated_facts:
Facts:
1. Temperature was maintained at 60 C because it was necessary to maintain a stable temperature for the reaction system.
2. The reaction system was warmed up to 140 C in order to increase its temperature and facilitate chemical reactions.
3. The temperature of the reaction system increased by 80 C in 40 min due to the heating process.
4. The reaction system was maintained at 140 C for 20 min because it allowed for optimal conditions for the desired chemical reaction.
5. The temperature of the reaction system decreased to room temperature after the reaction was completed, indicating that the reaction had reached its final stage.
6. Centrifugation was performed on the reddish-brown suspension in order to separate the solid particles from the liquid phase.
7. The red NPs were collected after centrifugation because they were the desired product of the separation process.
8. The red NPs were rinsed with acetone and then with water due to their hydrophobic nature, which required a combination of solvents for complete removal.
9. AgNO3 was used to prepare normal Ag/AgCl materials because it is a common reagent in the synthesis of silver chloride compounds.
10. The reaction system was compared with the preparation of normal Ag/AgCl materials in order to evaluate its effectiveness and efficiency in producing the desired product.

evidences.pdf_reference: Optical absorption, as the fundamental requirement of photocatalysts, still has immense space for development.Herein, we design a novel kind of red Ag/AgCl photocatalyst, by which a large improvement of visible-light harvesting was obtained.These strongly coloured semiconductor materials can be facilely prepared using a versatile glycerol-mediated method and exhibit a uniform coaxial tricubic morphology.The enhancement of optical absorption is not only ascribed to the synergy of Ag and AgCl but also attributed to the Mie scattering effect due to the distinct morphology.As expected, the
